verb.description: Move or cause to move continuously or freely through a closed system or area.
examples: the fan circulates hot air around the oven

verb.description: Pass or cause to pass from place to place or person to person.
examples: they were circulating the list to conservation groups

origin: Late 15th century (as an alchemical term meaning distill something in a closed container, allowing condensed vapor to return to the original liquid): from Latin circulat- moved in a circular path, from the verb circulare, from circulus small ring (see circle). circulate (sense 1) dates from the mid 17th century.
